page.title: 12SUNDAYS AT HOME
page.content: On Sunday mornings the children get up at 10.30a.m. and have a cup of tea. They do the "bottling-up"-this is checking on the number of bottles needed to fill the shelves and visit- ing the cellar to stock up. The bottles are cleaned and placed on the shelves. The children clean the living rooms with the vacuum cleaner and polish the tops.They stock up with bar snacks such as peanuts,crisps,pickled onions and"cheese snips".The bins are emptied and the passage cleaned. Then they sit down with a glass of coke or lemonade while their mother is cooking Sunday lunches for the pub customers. Often she makes 30-40 roast meals.They set the table at 2.30p.m. for the family to have dinner. Later they help to wash the pots and pans and take the dog for a walk. Then they watch tele- vision, have supper and go to bed.
